Category.Name: DeviceControl
Category.ToolTip: Category for Device information and control.
Category.Description: Category for Device information and control.

StringReg.Name: DeviceVendorName
StringReg.ToolTip: Name of the manufacturer of the device.
StringReg.Description: Name of the manufacturer of the device.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceTemperatureSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the location within the device, where the temperature will be measured.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the location within the device, where the temperature will be measured.

Float.Name: DeviceTemperature
Float.ToolTip: Device temperature in degrees Celsius (C). It is measured at the location selected by DeviceTemperatureSelector.
Float.Description: Device temperature in degrees Celsius (C). It is measured at the location selected by DeviceTemperatureSelector. Use feature DeviceTemperature_Update to update this value.

Command.Name: DeviceTemperature_Update
Command.ToolTip: Updates the DeviceTemperature value.
Command.Description: Updates the DeviceTemperature value.

Command.Name: DeviceReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the device to its power up state.
Command.Description: Resets the device to its power up state.

Command.Name: CameraHeadReset
Command.ToolTip: This command resets the camera to its boot up state.
Command.Description: This command resets the camera to its boot up state.

Category.Name: ImageFormatControl
Category.ToolTip: Category for Image Format Control features.
Category.Description: Category for Image Format Control features.

Enumeration.Name: SensorDigitizationTaps
Enumeration.ToolTip: Number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.
Enumeration.Description: Number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.

Integer.Name: WidthMax
Integer.ToolTip: This feature represents the maximum width (in pixels) of the image after horizontal binning, decimation or any other function changing the horizontal dimensions of the image.
Integer.Description: This feature represents the maximum width (in pixels) of the image after horizontal binning, decimation or any other function changing the horizontal dimensions of the image.

Integer.Name: HeightMax
Integer.ToolTip: This feature represents the maximum height (in pixels) of the image after vertical binning, decimation or any other function changing the vertical dimensions of the image.
Integer.Description: This feature represents the maximum height (in pixels) of the image after vertical binning, decimation or any other function changing the vertical dimensions of the image.

Integer.Name: WidthInterface
Integer.ToolTip: Width of image on the camera interface (Number of columns).
Integer.Description: Width of image on the camera interface (Number of columns).

Integer.Name: HeightInterface
Integer.ToolTip: Height of image on the camera interface (Number of lines).
Integer.Description: Height of image on the camera interface (Number of lines).

Integer.Name: Width
Integer.ToolTip: Width of the transfered image. Feature Window_W and Width has to be set manually. Window_W means image width on the CMOS sensor. The image width on the GigE interface (Width) is different, because of the DR1 compressor.
Integer.Description: Width of the transfered image. Feature Window_W and Width has to be set manually. Window_W means image width on the CMOS sensor. The image width on the GigE interface (Width) is different, because of the DR1 compressor.

Integer.Name: Height
Integer.ToolTip: Height of the image provided by the device (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Height of the image provided by the device (in pixels).

Integer.Name: OffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: Start of region of interest (Top left corner).
Integer.Description: Start of region of interest (Top left corner).

Integer.Name: OffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Start of region of interest (Top left corner).
Integer.Description: Start of region of interest (Top left corner).

Integer.Name: Window_W
Integer.ToolTip: Width of camera head. Feature Window_W and Width has to be set manually. Window_W means image width on the CMOS sensor. The image width on the GigE interface (Width) is different, because of the DR1 compressor.
Integer.Description: Width of camera head. Feature Window_W and Width has to be set manually. Window_W means image width on the CMOS sensor. The image width on the GigE interface (Width) is different, because of the DR1 compressor.

Integer.Name: BinningHorizontal
Integer.ToolTip: This feature represents the number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells that must be combined (added) together.
Integer.Description: This feature represents the number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells that must be combined (added) together.

Integer.Name: BinningVertical
Integer.ToolTip: This feature represents the number of vertical photo-sensitive cells that must be combined (added) together.
Integer.Description: This feature represents the number of vertical photo-sensitive cells that must be combined (added) together.

Integer.Name: DecimationHorizontal
Integer.ToolTip: This feature allows horizontal sub-sampling of the image.
Integer.Description: This feature allows horizontal sub-sampling of the image.

Integer.Name: DecimationVertical
Integer.ToolTip: This feature allows vertical sub-sampling of the image. The new height of the image has to be set manually.
Integer.Description: This feature allows vertical sub-sampling of the image. The new height of the image has to be set manually.

Enumeration.Name: PixelFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Format of the pixel to use for acquisition.
Enumeration.Description: Format of the pixel to use for acquisition. It represents all the informations provided by PixelCoding, PixelSize, PixelColorFilter but combined in one single value.

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.ToolTip: This feature indicates the effective width of the sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: This feature indicates the effective width of the sensor in pixels.

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.ToolTip: This feature indicates the effective height of the sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: This feature indicates the effective height of the sensor in pixels.

Category.Name: AcquisitionControl
Category.ToolTip: Category for the acquisition and trigger control features.
Category.Description: Category for the acquisition and trigger control features.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode of the device.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the acquisition mode of the device. It defines mainly the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.ToolTip: Starts the Acquisition of the device.
Command.Description: Starts the Acquisition of the device. The number of frames captured is specified by AcquisitionMode.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.ToolTip: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current Frame.
Command.Description: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current Frame. It is mainly used when AcquisitionMode is Continuous but can be used in any acquisition mode.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionFrameCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of frames to acquire in MultiFrame Acquisition mode.
Integer.Description: Number of frames to acquire in MultiFrame Acquisition mode.

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enable Constant Frame Rate. Only available if TriggerMode is disabled.
Boolean.Description: Enable Constant Frame Rate. Only available if TriggerMode is disabled.

Float.Name: AcquisitionFrameRate
Float.ToolTip: Frame rate of the camera. Only available if AcquisitionFrameRateEnable is enabled.
Float.Description: Frame rate of the camera. Only available if AcquisitionFrameRateEnable is enabled.

Float.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateMax
Float.ToolTip: Shows max frame rate with current settings.
Float.Description: Shows max frame rate with current settings.

Float.Name: AcquisitionFrameTime
Float.ToolTip: Frame time of the camera in microseconds. Only available if AcquisitionFrameRateEnable is enabled.
Float.Description: Frame time of the camera in microseconds. Only available if AcquisitionFrameRateEnable is enabled.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of trigger to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of trigger to configure.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: External trigger mode. TriggerMode=Off means Free-running trigger.
Enumeration.Description: External trigger mode. TriggerMode=Off means Free-running trigger.

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.ToolTip: Simulate an external trigger event. Only available if TriggerMode is enabled and TriggerSource is set to Software.
Command.Description: Simulate an external trigger event. Only available if TriggerMode is enabled and TriggerSource is set to Software.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Trigger input selection.
Enumeration.Description: Trigger input selection. Software: TriggerSoftware as trigger source. PLC_Q4: PLC_Q4 output as trigger source. Line1: ISO_IN1 as trigger source ABTrigger:

Enumeration.Name: TriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: TriggerActivation specifies the activation mode of the trigger.
Enumeration.Description: TriggerActivation specifies the activation mode of the trigger.

Float.Name: TriggerDelay
Float.ToolTip: Gives additional delay from active edge of external trigger to exposure start. The unit is us.
Float.Description: Gives additional delay from active edge of external trigger to exposure start. The unit is us.

Float.Name: TriggerDelayAbs
Float.ToolTip: Gives additional delay from active edge of external trigger to exposure start. The unit is us.
Float.Description: Gives additional delay from active edge of external trigger to exposure start. The unit is us.

Integer.Name: TriggerDivider
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies a division factor for the incoming trigger pulses.
Integer.Description: Specifies a division factor for the incoming trigger pulses.

Boolean.Name: ABTriggerDebounce
Boolean.ToolTip: Suppresses the generation of triggers when the A/B signal bounce.
Boolean.Description: Suppresses the generation of triggers when the A/B signal bounce.

Enumeration.Name: ABTriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Determines how many triggers should be generated. Available modes: single, double, quad.
Enumeration.Description: Determines how many triggers should be generated. Available modes: single, double, quad.

Enumeration.Name: ABTriggerDirection
Enumeration.ToolTip: Determines in which direction a trigger should be generated.
Enumeration.Description: Determines in which direction a trigger should be generated.

Integer.Name: ABTriggerResolution
Integer.ToolTip: Number of internal triggers to skip. Value 0 means that all internal triggers should be applied to the camera.
Integer.Description: Number of internal triggers to skip. Value 0 means that all internal triggers should be applied to the camera.

Integer.Name: ABTriggerDivider
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies a division factor for the incoming AB-trigger pulses.
Integer.Description: Specifies a division factor for the incoming AB-trigger pulses.

Boolean.Name: ABTriggerAOnly
Boolean.ToolTip: If enabled, only A signal is processed.
Boolean.Description: If enabled, only A signal is processed.

Boolean.Name: ABTriggerCountAlways
Boolean.ToolTip: If enabled, count (calculate) encoder position always. If disabled, count encoder position only if property Trigger.EnABTrigger is enabled.
Boolean.Description: If enabled, count (calculate) encoder position always. If disabled, count encoder position only if property Trigger.EnABTrigger is enabled.

Integer.Name: ABEncoderPosition
Integer.ToolTip: Counter (signed integer) that corresponds to the position of incremental encoder. The counter frequency depends on the ABMode. It counts up/down pulses independent of the ABTriggerDirection. Writing to this feature resets the counter to 0.
Integer.Description: Counter (signed integer) that corresponds to the position of incremental encoder. The counter frequency depends on the ABMode. It counts up/down pulses independent of the ABTriggerDirection. Writing to this feature resets the counter to 0.

Command.Name: ABEncoderPositionUpdate
Command.ToolTip: Updates the ABEncoderPosition value.
Command.Description: Updates the ABEncoderPosition value.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Choose control of exposure time by length of trigger pulse or defined by camera.
Enumeration.Description: Choose control of exposure time by length of trigger pulse (applies to TriggerMode=On only) or defined by camera (Feature ExposureTime). When set to TriggerWidth, the active trigger edge starts exposure and the inactive edge stops exposure.

Float.Name: ExposureTime
Float.ToolTip: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.
Float.Description: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.

Float.Name: ExposureTimeAbs
Float.ToolTip: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.
Float.Description: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.

Category.Name: CounterAndTimerControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Counter and Timer control features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the Counter and Timer control features.

Enumeration.Name: CounterSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which counter to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which counter to configure.

Enumeration.Name: CounterEventSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select the events that will be the source to increment the counter.
Enumeration.Description: Select the events that will be the source to increment the counter.

Enumeration.Name: CounterDecrementEventSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the event that decrements the counter.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the event that decrements the counter.

Enumeration.Name: CounterResetSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signals that will be the source to reset the counter.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signals that will be the source to reset the counter.

Enumeration.Name: CounterResetActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the Activation mode counter Reset Source signal.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the Activation mode counter Reset Source signal.

Integer.Name: CounterValue
Integer.ToolTip: Reads or writes the current value of the selected counter.
Integer.Description: Reads or writes the current value of the selected counter.

Integer.Name: CounterDuration
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the duration (or number of events) before the CounterEnd event is generated.
Integer.Description: Sets the duration (or number of events) before the CounterEnd event is generated.

Enumeration.Name: CounterTriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the source to start the counter.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the source to start the counter.

Enumeration.Name: TimerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Timer to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Timer to configure.

Integer.Name: TimerDurationRaw
Integer.ToolTip: It sets the duration in device-specific unit of the Timer pulse.
Integer.Description: It sets the duration in device-specific unit of the Timer pulse.

Integer.Name: TimerDelayRaw
Integer.ToolTip: It sets the duration in device-specific unit of the delay to apply after the reception of a trigger before to start the Timer.
Integer.Description: It sets the duration in device-specific unit of the delay to apply after the reception of a trigger before to start the Timer.

Enumeration.Name: TimerTriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the source of the trigger to start the Timer.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the source of the trigger to start the Timer.

Enumeration.Name: TimerTriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the activation mode of the trigger to start the Timer.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the activation mode of the trigger to start the Timer.

Integer.Name: TimerGranularityFactor
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the granularity of the TimerDurationRaw and TimerDelayRaw features (in increments of ~30 ns).
Integer.Description: Controls the granularity of the TimerDurationRaw and TimerDelayRaw features (in increments of ~30 ns). A value of 0 represents a granularity of ~30 ns.

Float.Name: TimerPeriod
Float.ToolTip: Returns the period, in ns, of the selected timer.
Float.Description: Returns the period, in ns, of the selected timer.

Float.Name: TimerFrequency
Float.ToolTip: Returns the frequency, in Hertz, of the selected timer.
Float.Description: Returns the frequency, in Hertz, of the selected timer.

Category.Name: EventControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Event control features.
Category.Description: Category that contains Event control features.

Enumeration.Name: EventSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Event to signal to the host application.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Event to signal to the host application.

Enumeration.Name: EventNotification
Enumeration.ToolTip: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.
Enumeration.Description: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.

Category.Name: PLC
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the PLC event features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the PLC event features.

Integer.Name: PLC_Interrupt_FIFO0_StreamChannelIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the index of the stream channel associated with the PLC interrupt FIFO event.
Integer.Description: Returns the index of the stream channel associated with the PLC interrupt FIFO event. 0xFFFF if no stream channel is associated to this event.

Integer.Name: PLC_Interrupt_FIFO0_BlockID
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the block ID associated with the PLC interrupt FIFO event.
Integer.Description: Returns the block ID associated with the PLC interrupt FIFO event. 0 if no block ID is associated to this event.

Integer.Name: PLC_Interrupt_FIFO0_Timestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the timestamp associated with the PLC interrupt FIFO event.
Integer.Description: Returns the timestamp associated with the PLC interrupt FIFO event.

Integer.Name: PLC_Interrupt_FIFO0_SRB_mask
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the state of the PLC signal routing block outputs upon the occurrence of the event.
Integer.Description: Returns the state of the PLC signal routing block outputs upon the occurrence of the event.

Integer.Name: PLC_Interrupt_FIFO0_IRQ_mask
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the state of the PLC events vector upon the occurrence of the event.
Integer.Description: Returns the state of the PLC events vector upon the occurrence of the event.

Integer.Name: PLC_Interrupt_FIFO0_time
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the state of the 32 least significant bits of the timestamp upon the occurrence of the event.
Integer.Description: Returns the state of the 32 least significant bits of the timestamp upon the occurrence of the event.

Category.Name: IPEngineCamHeadSerialComLog
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the IP engine to camera head serial communication log event features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the IP engine to camera head serial communication log event features.
Category.DisplayName: IP Engine to Camera Head Serial Communication Log

Integer.Name: IPEngineCamHeadSerialComLogEventStreamChannelIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the index of the stream channel associated with the camera head-to-serial communication log event.
Integer.Description: Returns the index of the stream channel associated with the camera head-to-serial communication log event. 0xFFFF if no stream channel is associated to this event.

Integer.Name: IPEngineCamHeadSerialComLogEventBlockID
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the block ID associated with the camera head-to-serial communication log event.
Integer.Description: Returns the block ID associated with the camera head-to-serial communication log event. 0 if no block ID is associated to this event.

Integer.Name: IPEngineCamHeadSerialComLogEventTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the timestamp associated with the camera head-to-serial communication log event.
Integer.Description: Returns the timestamp associated with the camera head-to-serial communication log event.

Category.Name: AnalogControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Analog control features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the Analog control features.

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features. Only DigitalAll available
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features. Only DigitalAll available

Float.Name: Gain
Float.ToolTip: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.
Float.Description: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.

Integer.Name: GainRaw
Integer.ToolTip: This feature is deprecated.
Integer.Description: This feature is deprecated. It controls the selected gain as a raw integer value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.

Float.Name: GainAbs
Float.ToolTip: This feature is deprecated.
Float.Description: This feature is deprecated. This feature controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value.

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features.

Float.Name: BlackLevel
Float.ToolTip: BlackLevelOffset of the Camera.
Float.Description: BlackLevelOffset of the Camera.

Integer.Name: BlackLevelRaw
Integer.ToolTip: BlackLevelOffset of the Camera.
Integer.Description: BlackLevelOffset of the Camera.

Float.Name: FineGain
Float.ToolTip: Gain of the camera.
Float.Description: Gain of the camera.

Integer.Name: DigitalOffset
Integer.ToolTip: Subtracts an offset from the Data.
Integer.Description: Subtracts an offset from the Data.

Category.Name: LUTControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that includes the LUT control features.
Category.Description: Category that includes the LUT control features.

Enumeration.Name: LUTSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which LUT to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which LUT to control.

Boolean.Name: LUTEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Activates the selected LUT.
Boolean.Description: Activates the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LUTIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Control the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.
Integer.Description: Control the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT. Size of LUTIndex is 12 bit. Size of LUTValue is 8 bit. (12 to 8 bit LUT)

Integer.Name: LUTValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Value at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.
Integer.Description: Returns the Value at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector. Size of LUTIndex is 12 bit. Size of LUTValue is 8 bit. (12 to 8 bit LUT)

Enumeration.Name: LUTAutoMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Set the mode of the selected LUT. To update the LUT values, modify LUT_AutoValue.
Enumeration.Description: Set the mode of the selected LUT. To update the LUT values, modify LUT_AutoValue.

Float.Name: LUTAutoValue
Float.ToolTip: Value for the LUT_AutoMode function of the selected LUT.
Float.Description: Value for the LUT_AutoMode function of the selected LUT. Set first LUT_AutoMode, then LUT_AutoValue. Range for Gain: [1.0, 4.0], Range for Gamma: [0.4, 4.0].

Integer.Name: LUT_X
Integer.ToolTip: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.
Integer.Description: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.

Integer.Name: LUT_Y
Integer.ToolTip: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.
Integer.Description: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.

Integer.Name: LUT_W
Integer.ToolTip: Width of region of interest of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.
Integer.Description: Width of region of interest of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.

Integer.Name: LUT_H
Integer.ToolTip: Height of region of interest of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.
Integer.Description: Height of region of interest of the selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.

Command.Name: LUT_ROIMax
Command.ToolTip: Set window settings to max. region of interest of selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.
Command.Description: Set window settings to max. region of interest of selected LUT. Only available if LUT_EnRegionLUT is enabled.

Boolean.Name: LUT_EnRegionLUT
Boolean.ToolTip: Enable region LUT. Every LUT is only working inside the LUT ROI values.
Boolean.Description: Enable region LUT. Every LUT is only working inside the LUT ROI values.

Category.Name: LUT0
Category.ToolTip: ToolTip
Category.Description: Description

Boolean.Name: LUT0_Enable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enable LUT0.
Boolean.Description: Enable LUT0.

Enumeration.Name: LUT0_Mode
Enumeration.ToolTip: This property set only the active lut mode. To calculate the LUT new, set the property LUT0_Value.
Enumeration.Description: This property set only the active lut mode. To calculate the LUT new, set the property LUT0_Value.

Float.Name: LUT0_Value
Float.ToolTip: Value for Gain- or Gamma-function. Set first LUT0_Mode, then LUT0_Value.
Float.Description: Value for Gain- or Gamma-function. Set first LUT0_Mode, then LUT0_Value.

Integer.Name: LUT0_Address
Integer.ToolTip: LUT_Address is equivalent to the original brightness of the pixel. LUT_Data is equivalent to the new brightness value of the pixel.
Integer.Description: LUT_Address is equivalent to the original brightness of the pixel. LUT_Data is equivalent to the new brightness value of the pixel. Size of LUT_Address is 12 bit. Size of LUT_Data is 8 bit. (12 to 8 bit LUT)

Integer.Name: LUT0_Data
Integer.ToolTip: LUT_Address is equivalent to the original brightness of the pixel. LUT_Data is equivalent to the new brightness value of the pixel.
Integer.Description: LUT_Address is equivalent to the original brightness of the pixel. LUT_Data is equivalent to the new brightness value of the pixel. Size of LUT_Address is 12 bit. Size of LUT_Data is 8 bit. (12 to 8 bit LUT)

Integer.Name: LUT0_X
Integer.ToolTip: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of LUT0.
Integer.Description: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of LUT0.

Integer.Name: LUT0_Y
Integer.ToolTip: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of LUT0.
Integer.Description: Start of region of interest (Top left corner) of LUT0.

Integer.Name: LUT0_W
Integer.ToolTip: Width of region of interest of LUT0.
Integer.Description: Width of region of interest of LUT0.

Integer.Name: LUT0_H
Integer.ToolTip: Height of region of interest of LUT0.
Integer.Description: Height of region of interest of LUT0.

Command.Name: LUT0_Max
Command.ToolTip: Set Window to max. region of interest of LUT0.
Command.Description: Set Window to max. region of interest of LUT0.

Boolean.Description: Enable LUT1.

Enumeration.ToolTip: This property set only the active lut mode. To calculate the LUT new, set the property LUT1_Value.
Enumeration.Description: This property set only the active lut mode. To calculate the LUT new, set the property LUT1_Value.

Float.ToolTip: Value for Gain- or Gamma-function. Set first LUT1_Mode, then LUT1_Value.

Integer.ToolTip: LUT_Address is equivalent to the original brightness of the pixel. LUT_Data is equivalent to the new brightness value of the pixel.

Integer.ToolTip: LUT_Address is equivalent to the original brightness of the pixel. LUT_Data is equivalent to the new brightness value of the pixel.

Category.Name: TransportLayerControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Transport layer control features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the Transport layer control features.

Integer.Name: PayloadSize
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel.
Integer.Description: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel. This includes any end-of-line, end-of-frame statistics or other stamp data. This is the total size of data payload for a data block.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMajor
Integer.ToolTip: Major version of the specification.
Integer.Description: Major version of the specification.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMinor
Integer.ToolTip: Minor version of the specification.
Integer.Description: Minor version of the specification.

Boolean.Name: GevDeviceModeIsBigEndian
Boolean.ToolTip: Endianess of the device registers.
Boolean.Description: Endianess of the device registers.
Boolean.DisplayName: GEV Device Mode Is Big Endian

Enumeration.Name: GevDeviceClass
Enumeration.ToolTip: Returns the class of the device.
Enumeration.Description: Returns the class of the device.

Enumeration.Name: GevDeviceModeCharacterSet
Enumeration.ToolTip: Character set used by all the strings of the bootstrap registers.
Enumeration.Description: Character set used by all the strings of the bootstrap registers.

Integer.Name: GevInterfaceSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects which physical network interface to control.
Integer.Description: Selects which physical network interface to control.

Integer.Name: GevMACAddress
Integer.ToolTip: MAC address of the network interface.
Integer.Description: MAC address of the network interface.

Enumeration.Name: GevSupportedOptionSelector

Enumeration.Description: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOption

Integer.Description: Reports the default gateway IP address to be used on the given network interface.

Enumeration.Name: GevIPConfigurationStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Reports the current IP configuration status.
Enumeration.Description: Reports the current IP configuration status.

StringReg.Name: GevFirstURL
StringReg.ToolTip: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file.
StringReg.Description: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file. The First URL is used as the first choice by the application to retrieve the XML device description file.

StringReg.Name: GevSecondURL
StringReg.ToolTip: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file.
StringReg.Description: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file. This URL is an alternative if the application was unsuccessful to retrieve the device description file using the first URL.

Integer.Name: GevNumberOfInterfaces
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Persistent IP address for this network interface.
Integer.Description: Controls the Persistent IP address for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentSubnetMask
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface.
Integer.Description: Controls the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentDefaultGateway
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the persistent default gateway for this network interface.
Integer.Description: Controls the persistent default gateway for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.

Enumeration.Name: GevTimestampCounterSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the source counter for GigE Vision timestamps.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the source counter for GigE Vision timestamps. GigE Vision timestamps are used in GigE Vision streaming and event packets. Also, GigE Vision timestamps can be inserted as metadata in images.

Enumeration.Name: GevTimestampSetSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal that sets the counter to GevTimestampValueAtSet.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal that sets the counter to GevTimestampValueAtSet.

Enumeration.Name: GevTimestampSetActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the activation mode for the counter set source signal.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the activation mode for the counter set source signal.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValueAtSet
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the value to be set in the counter when the set event occurs.
Integer.Description: Controls the value to be set in the counter when the set event occurs.

Enumeration.Name: GevTimestampResetSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal that resets the counter (to 0).
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal that resets the counter (to 0).

Enumeration.Name: GevTimestampResetActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the activation mode for the counter reset source signal.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the activation mode for the counter reset source signal.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampTickFrequency
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of timestamp ticks in 1 second (frequency in Hz).
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of timestamp ticks in 1 second (frequency in Hz).

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlLatch
Command.ToolTip: Latches the current timestamp counter into GevTimestampValue.
Command.Description: Latches the current timestamp counter into GevTimestampValue.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlSet
Command.ToolTip: Sets the counter to GevTimestampValueAtSet.
Command.Description: Sets the counter to GevTimestampValueAtSet.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the timestamp counter to 0.
Command.Description: Resets the timestamp counter to 0.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the latched 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.
Integer.Description: Returns the latched 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.

Enumeration.Name: GevCCP
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the device access privilege of an application.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application.

Integer.Name: GevMCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the port to which the device must send messages.
Integer.Description: Controls the port to which the device must send messages. Setting this value to 0 closes the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCDA
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the destination IP address for the message channel.
Integer.Description: Controls the destination IP address for the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCTT
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.
Integer.Description: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.

Integer.Name: GevMCRC
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the number of retransmissions allowed when a message channel message times out.
Integer.Description: Controls the number of retransmissions allowed when a message channel message times out.

Integer.Name: GevMCSP
Integer.ToolTip: This feature indicates the source port for the message channel.
Integer.Description: This feature indicates the source port for the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the stream channel to control.
Integer.Description: Selects the stream channel to control.

Enumeration.Name: GevSCPDirection
Enumeration.ToolTip: Reports the direction of the stream channel.
Enumeration.Description: Reports the direction of the stream channel.

Integer.Name: GevSCPInterfaceIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Index of network interface to use.
Integer.Description: Index of network interface to use.

Integer.Name: GevSCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the port of the selected channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the port from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.
Integer.Description: Controls the port of the selected channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the port from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream. Setting this value to 0 closes the stream channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSFireTestPacket
Boolean.ToolTip: Sends a test packet.
Boolean.Description: Sends a test packet. When this feature is set, the device will fire one test packet.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSDoNotFragment
Boolean.ToolTip: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet.
Boolean.Description: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet. It can be used by the application to prevent IP fragmentation of packets on the stream channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSBigEndian
Boolean.ToolTip: Endianess of multi-byte pixel data for this stream.
Boolean.Description: Endianess of multi-byte pixel data for this stream.

Integer.Name: GevSCPSPacketSize
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the stream packet size, in bytes, to send on the selected channel for a GVSP transmitter or specifies the maximum packet size supported by a GVSP receiver.
Integer.Description: Specifies the stream packet size, in bytes, to send on the selected channel for a GVSP transmitter or specifies the maximum packet size supported by a GVSP receiver.

Integer.Name: GevSCPD
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel.
Integer.Description: Controls the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel. This can be used as a crude flow-control mechanism if the application or the network infrastructure cannot keep up with the packets coming from the device.

Integer.Name: GevSCDA
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the destination IP address of the selected stream channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the destination IP address from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.
Integer.Description: Controls the destination IP address of the selected stream channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the destination IP address from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.

Integer.Name: GevSCSP
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the source port of the stream channel.
Integer.Description: Indicates the source port of the stream channel.

Category.Name: Rescaler0
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the rescaler features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the rescaler features.

Enumeration.Name: PLC_rsl0_Granularity
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the duration between samples, measured in system clock cycles (~30 ns).
Enumeration.Description: Controls the duration between samples, measured in system clock cycles (~30 ns).

Enumeration.Name: PLC_rsl0_Multiplier
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the multiplier controlling the frequency of the rescaler output signal.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the multiplier controlling the frequency of the rescaler output signal.

Integer.Name: PLC_rsl0_Divider
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the divisor controlling the frequency of the rescaler output signal.
Integer.Description: Sets the divisor controlling the frequency of the rescaler output signal.

Enumeration.Name: PLC_rsl0_InputSignal
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal to be rescaled.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal to be rescaled.

Boolean.Name: PLC_rsl0_BackupEnabled
Boolean.ToolTip: Controls whether the rescaler switches to the backup input signal if the input signal stops.
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the rescaler switches to the backup input signal if the input signal stops. The backup input signal is not rescaled.

Integer.Name: PLC_rsl0_BackupSwitchoverDelay
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the duration of the delay to switchover, in increments of ~480 ns.
Integer.Description: Controls the duration of the delay to switchover, in increments of ~480 ns. If the rescaler detects no rising edge transition of the input signal during this switchover delay, it switches to the backup signal. When a rising edge transition is detected on the input signal, the rescaler switches back to the input signal.

Enumeration.Name: PLC_rsl0_BackupInputSignal
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the replacement signal if the input signal stops.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the replacement signal if the input signal stops.

Float.Name: PLC_rsl0_InputFrequency
Float.ToolTip: Returns the frequency, in Hertz, of the selected input signal.
Float.Description: Returns the frequency, in Hertz, of the selected input signal.

Float.Name: PLC_rsl0_OutputFrequency
Float.ToolTip: Returns the frequency, in Hertz, of the output from the rescaler.
Float.Description: Returns the frequency, in Hertz, of the output from the rescaler.

Enumeration.Name: PLC_rsl0_SampleSize
Enumeration.ToolTip: Returns the size of the sampling counter that is evaluating the frequency of the input signal.
Enumeration.Description: Returns the size of the sampling counter that is evaluating the frequency of the input signal.

Category.Description: Category that contains the delayer features.

Integer.Name: PLC_del0_DelayCount
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the amount of time by which the delayer output signal will be delayed from the input signal.
Integer.Description: Controls the amount of time by which the delayer output signal will be delayed from the input signal. This delay is measured in number of periods of the reference signal.

Enumeration.Name: PLC_del0_ReferenceTimingSignal
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the reference signal that measures how much to delay the input signal.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the reference signal that measures how much to delay the input signal. The period of the reference signal determines both the rate at which the delayer samples the input and the duration of a delay count of 1.

Enumeration.Name: PLC_del0_InputSignal
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal to be delayed.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal to be delayed.

Category.ToolTip: ToolTip

Float.Name: Strobe_Delay
Float.ToolTip: The camera generates a strobe output signal that can be used to control a flash light.
Float.Description: The camera generates a strobe output signal that can be used to control a flash light. The output is a pulse whose delay and pulse width can be set as follows. The delay from the active input trigger edge to the rising edge of the strobe output signal is set ths property. The values are specified in us.

Float.Name: Strobe_PulseWidth
Float.ToolTip: The camera generates a strobe output signal that can be used to control a flash light.
Float.Description: The camera generates a strobe output signal that can be used to control a flash light. The output is a pulse whose delay and pulse width can be set as follows. The width of the pulse is set with this property. The values are specified in us.

Boolean.Name: Strobe_Invert
Boolean.ToolTip: Invert strobe output.
Boolean.Description: Invert strobe output.

Category.Name: BurstTrigger
Category.ToolTip: ToolTip
Category.Description: Description

Boolean.Name: Trigger_EnBurstTrigger
Boolean.ToolTip: The burst trigger generator generates a given number of internal triggers in response to each external trigger event received. Only available if TriggerMode is enabled.
Boolean.Description: The burst trigger generator generates a given number of internal triggers in response to each external trigger event received. The number of triggers in the resulting burst, and the period between these triggers, can be configured. The burst trigger generator can be used with the external trigger. It is ignored when the camera is in free-running mode. Only available if TriggerMode is enabled.

Integer.Name: Trigger_NrOfBurstTrigger
Integer.ToolTip: Number of triggers to generate in a burst. This is the number of burst triggers which will be generated internally as soon as an external trigger event is received. Only available if Trigger_EnBurstTrigger is enabled.
Integer.Description: Number of triggers to generate in a burst. This is the number of burst triggers which will be generated internally as soon as an external trigger event is received. Only available if Trigger_EnBurstTrigger is enabled.

Float.Name: Trigger_BurstTriggerPeriodTime
Float.ToolTip: Burst trigger period. Trigger period time between two internal burst trigger events. This effectively sets the framerate within a burst. The values are specified in us. Only available if Trigger_EnBurstTrigger is enabled.
Float.Description: Burst trigger period. Trigger period time between two internal burst trigger events. This effectively sets the framerate within a burst. The values are specified in us. Only available if Trigger_EnBurstTrigger is enabled.

Float.Name: Trigger_BurstTriggerDelay
Float.ToolTip: Burst trigger delay. It delays the incoming trigger by the specified time. If the trigger delay exceeds the trigger period time, no trigger will be processed. The values are specified in us. Only available if Trigger_EnBurstTrigger is enabled.
Float.Description: Burst trigger delay. It delays the incoming trigger by the specified time. If the trigger delay exceeds the trigger period time, no trigger will be processed. The values are specified in us. Only available if Trigger_EnBurstTrigger is enabled.

Category.Name: Counters
Category.ToolTip: ToolTip
Category.Description: Description

Integer.Name: Counter_Image
Integer.ToolTip: For every images: ImageCounter++; Every write access, set this feature to 0. Max. value is 16'777'215 (24Bit).
Integer.Description: For every images: ImageCounter++; Every write access, set this feature to 0. Max. value is 16'777'215 (24Bit). Use feature Counter_ImageUpdate to update this value.

Command.Name: Counter_ImageUpdate
Command.ToolTip: Updates the Counter_Image value.
Command.Description: Updates the Counter_Image value.

Command.Name: Counter_ImageReset
Command.ToolTip: Reset the Counter_Image value.
Command.Description: Reset the Counter_Image value.

Integer.Name: Counter_MissedTrigger
Integer.ToolTip: Counts trigger pulses that could not be served. Missed triggers can only occur with the trigger sources 'Interface Trigger' or 'I/O Trigger'. A missed trigger is a trigger pulse that was received during image exposure or image readout; Every write access, set this feature to 0. The max. value is 255 (8Bit).
Integer.Description: Counts trigger pulses that could not be served. Missed triggers can only occur with the trigger sources 'Interface Trigger' or 'I/O Trigger'. A missed trigger is a trigger pulse that was received during image exposure or image readout; Every write access, set this feature to 0. The max. value is 255 (8Bit). Use feature Counter_MissedTriggerUpdate to update this value.

Command.Name: Counter_MissedTriggerUpdate
Command.ToolTip: Updates the Counter_MissedTrigger value.
Command.Description: Updates the Counter_MissedTrigger value.

Command.Name: Counter_MissedTriggerReset
Command.ToolTip: Reset the Counter_MissedTrigger value.
Command.Description: Reset the Counter_MissedTrigger value.

Integer.Name: Counter_MissedBurstTrigger
Integer.ToolTip: Counts burst trigger pulses that could not be served. Missed burst triggers can only occur with the trigger sources 'Interface Trigger' or 'I/O Trigger' and with the 'Trigger.EnBurstTrigger' property set to true. A missed burst trigger is a trigger pulse that was received during the last burst is not yet finished. Every write access, set this property to 0. The max. value is 255 (8Bit).
Integer.Description: Counts burst trigger pulses that could not be served. Missed burst triggers can only occur with the trigger sources 'Interface Trigger' or 'I/O Trigger' and with the 'Trigger.EnBurstTrigger' property set to true. A missed burst trigger is a trigger pulse that was received during the last burst is not yet finished. Every write access, set this property to 0. The max. value is 255 (8Bit). Use feature Counter_MissedBurstTriggerUpdate to update this value.

Command.Name: Counter_MissedBurstTriggerUpdate
Command.ToolTip: Updates the Counter_MissedBurstTrigger value.
Command.Description: Updates the Counter_MissedBurstTrigger value.

Command.Name: Counter_MissedBurstTriggerReset
Command.ToolTip: Reset the Counter_MissedBurstTrigger value.
Command.Description: Reset the Counter_MissedBurstTrigger value.

Enumeration.Name: ResetCounter_Mode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the ability to reset the "image counter" and the "real time counter" by an external signal.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the ability to reset the "image counter" and the "real time counter" by an external signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Reset once at the next active edge of the selected reset source after OnNextTrigger has been set.
EnumEntry.Description: Reset once at the next active edge of the selected reset source after OnNextTrigger has been set.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Reset at every active edge of the selected reset source.
EnumEntry.Description: Reset at every active edge of the selected reset source.

Enumeration.Name: ResetCounter_Source
Enumeration.ToolTip: Source for resetting image counter and real time counter by an external signal.
Enumeration.Description: Source for resetting image counter and real time counter by an external signal.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Use the active image trigger, the counter will be resetted when the exposure starts.
EnumEntry.Description: Use the active image trigger, the counter will be resetted when the exposure starts.

Command.Name: ResetCounter_OnNextTrigger
Command.ToolTip: If ResetCounter_Source=Once, arm the camera to use next selected trigger input to reset the counters.
Command.Description: If ResetCounter_Source=Once, arm the camera to use next selected trigger input to reset the counters.

Boolean.Name: ResetCounter_Invert
Boolean.ToolTip: Invert the input for resetting the counters.
Boolean.Description: Invert the input for resetting the counters.

Integer.Description: BlackLevelOffset of the Camera.

Category.Name: Multislope
Category.ToolTip: ToolTip
Category.Description: Description

Enumeration.Name: Multislope_Mode
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature sets the Multislope mode.
Enumeration.Description: This feature sets the Multislope mode. LowCompression: Multislope _Value1=80, Multislope _Value2=100, Multislope _Time1= 900, Multislope _Time2=800. NormalCompression: Multislope _Value1=100, Multislope _Value2=115, Multislope _Time1= 950, Multislope _Time2=900. HighCompression: Multislope _Value1=105, Multislope _Value2=120, Multislope _Time1= 980, Multislope _Time2=920.

Integer.Name: Multislope_NrSlopes
Integer.ToolTip: 2: 2 Slopes (1 Kneepoint), 3: 3 Slopes (2 Kneepoints)
Integer.Description: 2: 2 Slopes (1 Kneepoint), 3: 3 Slopes (2 Kneepoints)

Integer.Name: Multislope_Value1
Integer.ToolTip: Multislope Value corresponding to Time1. The higher the Voltage, the stronger the compression. See also camera manual.
Integer.Description: Multislope Value corresponding to Time1. The higher the Voltage, the stronger the compression. See also camera manual.

Integer.Name: Multislope_Value2
Integer.ToolTip: Multislope Value corresponding to Time2. The higher the Voltage, the stronger the compression. See also camera manual.
Integer.Description: Multislope Value corresponding to Time2. The higher the Voltage, the stronger the compression. See also camera manual.

Integer.Name: Multislope_Time1
Integer.ToolTip: Multislope switching time 1, see also camera manual.
Integer.Description: Multislope switching time 1, see also camera manual.

Integer.Name: Multislope_Time2
Integer.ToolTip: Multislope switching time 2, see also camera manual.
Integer.Description: Multislope switching time 2, see also camera manual.

Category.Name: ColCorrection
Category.ToolTip: ToolTip
Category.Description: Description

Boolean.Name: ColCorrection_Enable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enable ColCorrection.
Boolean.Description: Enable ColCorrection.

Command.Name: ColCorrection_CalibrateBlack
Command.ToolTip: The col-correction is based on a black reference image, which is taken at no illumination (e.g. lens aperture completely closed).
Command.Description: The col-correction is based on a black reference image, which is taken at no illumination (e.g. lens aperture completely closed). Close the lens of the camera.

Command.Name: ColCorrection_SaveToFlash
Command.ToolTip: Save correction values to Flash.
Command.Description: Save correction values to Flash.

Integer.Name: ColCorrection_Busy
Integer.ToolTip: Shows if ColCorrection is busy (SaveToFlash or Calculate)
Integer.Description: Shows if ColCorrection is busy (SaveToFlash or Calculate)

Integer.Name: ColCorrection_Overflow
Integer.ToolTip: Shows if one or more pixels have a higher value than 255 @ 10bit, when using ColCorrection_CalibrateBlack.
Integer.Description: Shows if one or more pixels have a higher value than 255 @ 10bit, when using ColCorrection_CalibrateBlack.

Integer.Name: ColCorrection_Underflow
Integer.ToolTip: Shows if one or more pixels have a value equal 0, when using ColCorrection_CalibrateBlack.
Integer.Description: Shows if one or more pixels have a value equal 0, when using ColCorrection_CalibrateBlack.

Command.Name: ColCorrection_Update
Command.ToolTip: Updates the ColCorrection_Busy value, ColCorrection_Overflow value and ColCorrection_Underflow value.
Command.Description: Updates the ColCorrection_Busy value, ColCorrection_Overflow value and ColCorrection_Underflow value.

Integer.Name: ColCorrection_Addr
Integer.ToolTip: Column Correction RAM Address.
Integer.Description: Column Correction RAM Address.

Integer.Name: ColCorrection_Data
Integer.ToolTip: Column Correction RAM Data.
Integer.Description: Column Correction RAM Data.
